articles.title: 'It's been a tricky one': Now World Cup preparations can begin, says relieved Bavuma
articles.description: ODI captain Temba Bavuma believes Proteas can now buckle down and focus on their preparations ahead of the Cricket World Cup in India.
articles.content:
• Temba Bavuma was a relieved man after South Africa's place in this year's Cricket World Cup was officially secured on Tuesday.

articles.title: How Elliott scored Ashes century while breastfeeding at lunch and tea
articles.description: In the latest of our From the Ashes series, Australia's Sarah Elliott remembers combining Ashes cricket with breastfeeding her nine-month-old son.
articles.content:
From the Ashes is a series of features and podcasts which dig deeper into tales of pain, despair and sometimes triumph in cricket's fiercest and most storied Test series.

articles.title: Door remains open for Faf, but fitness, T20 priorities a concern for Walter
articles.description: Proteas white-ball coach Rob Walter said former limited-overs captain Faf du Plessis still has an open door to the national team, but will have to understand the different workload requirements needed for 50-Over cricket.
